sub_title: Head of Group Treasury Reporting & Control
summary:
With a Bachelor’s degree in Finance, a MBA and 19 years of experience in Finance & Management I possess excellent analytical, organization and communication skills as well as deep understanding of financial processes and their impact on business decisions. I have the ability to effectively interact with all levels of management and extensive experience in preparing meaningful reports, streamlining processes, and driving efficiency. With my experience I have a high degree of sensitivity and discretion in working with confidential information as well as the ability to prioritize multiple responsibilities and manage deadlines accordingly. As a finance professional I am very proficient in the use of Excel and PowerPoint as well as affinity and experience with various accounting, consolidation, reporting and business intelligence software. Above all I am known for my high degree of integrity and work ethic and the building of fruitful relationships based on trust and respect.

Specialties: Financial Analysis, Reporting and Budgeting, Relationships management

certifications.name: IT Competence ( MS Office and Hardware )

profile_positions.description: Heading a department of 5 FTE's responsible for all Treasury Controlling & Reporting activities of the Group, including Middle & Back office operations.
profile_positions.title: Head of Group Treasury Reporting & Control

profile_positions.description:
With a key role in the Group Treasury I am responsible for:

•	the Controlling of the Financing Holding entity (Group Treasury) of the Group, including BS and PnL reporting, GL entries, accruals, reconciliations etc.
•	Internal & external Treasury reporting, including relevant KPI’s, covenants and compliance.
•	the Financial Risk Management (FRM) of the Group and compliance with Treasury Policy.
•	implementing IFRS 9 hedge accounting across the Group including hedge documentation.
•	executing and supervising middle and back office Treasury operations.
•	financing documentation including loan documentations, ISDAs, Commercial Paper IM, EMIR reporting, KYC’s etc.  
•	the controlling/analyzing/reporting of the FI&E of the Group on a monthly, quarterly & annual basis
•	providing Input for Annual report and press releases regarding FRM, Borrowings, Derivatives, Net Debt etc.
•	end of year Audit requests in field of responsibility. 
•	calculating companywide WACC.
•	providing various analytical support including Working Capital report, Net Debt reporting including projections and other analytical support on management requests.
•	providing input FI&E Budget & Budget vs Actual monitoring.
•	the management of I/C loan structure, I/C interest calculations including relevant input for tax and I/C loan documentation
profile_positions.title: Group Treasury Control & Analysis Manager

profile_positions.description:
•	review monthly financial statements of group entities, ensuring compliance with statutory, corporate reporting and financial agreements requirements, standards and Dutch GAAP/IFRS.
•	support and approve Balance sheet reconciliations, analysis and review, working closely with the Accounting and Consolidation & Reporting teams.
•	lead the Legal Entity/Business Unit/Profit Center Interest Charge project, documenting defined company policy and overseeing companywide implementation including verifying WACC and Capital Employed calculations.
•	support and approve corporate interest charge/rate bookings and Interest expense allocation to Business Units with direct impact on their PnL.
•	support annual closing process and quarterly reporting, providing/validating figures & commentary for the financial statements as well as preparing full or parts of the Management Discussion & Analysis document (MD&A).
•	conduct internal financial audits to the group entities, including review of GL bookings, explanations for accruals/deferrals, confirmation of inventory, afloat, cash positions etc
•	calculate, monitor, forecast and assure compliance with financial ratios regarding Group covenants.
•	support the preparation and review of earnings flashes, forecasts and budgets as well as interact with business on forecasting and actual result issues and processes.
•	support annual budgeting, internal forecasts as well as monitor and explain budget vs actual variances.
•	financial modeling of finance KPI’s including liquidity, performance and activity ratios.
•	calculate, monitor and forecast of treasury related risk metrics regarding debt management, liquidity planning, interest rate risks and FX exposures, including debt projections and cash flow planning.
•	lead Group Treasury reporting to Management and COFCO and the lenders as well as end responsible of all reporting requirements to the lenders based on the financial agreements.
profile_positions.title: Senior Controller/Analyst, Group Treasury&Finance
